channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How Trump speech turmoil led to ouster of BBC’s top bosses
History Today: When 'Sesame Street' debuted and changed childhood forever
FirstUp: Trump to meet Syrian president at White House, Cop30 to begin in Brazil... The big news
Can outdoors cure you? The science behind nature prescriptions
Eat until you are 80% full: Is Japanese philosophy of ‘hara hachi bu’ answer to healthy living?
Days of doomscrolling are over. How to find cheer online by bloomscrolling
A new nuclear race could begin as Trump and Putin revive Cold War shadows
item.description: At most at this point the posturing between the US and Russia can be seen as a new era of nuclear competition

item.title: How Pakistan’s 27th amendment will turn a ‘failed marshal’ into a dictator
item.description: No wonder PTI leader Imran Khan called Asim Munir the ‘most oppressive dictator in Pakistan’s history’

item.title: From anthem to ‘extra’: How Vande Mataram got marginalised in the name of secularism
item.description: The story of 'Vande Mataram' is the story of Bharat struggling to reconcile its ancient Sanatana soul with its modern ‘secular’ anxieties. It is also a reminder that concessions to a bully, even if he is a minority, never pay—they backfire

item.title: Beyond clamour of polls and silence of migration seeps the forgotten glory of Darbhanga Raj
item.description: At the time of Independence, Darbhanga was one of the subcontinent’s most prosperous and better-managed administrative units, whose rise and fall form an important chapter of India’s history

item.title: Creating a new ‘Mamdania’: Without their narrative, Hindu Americans have no future
item.description: South Asianists have a cultural monopoly now over Indian children in America, and Hindu Americans have failed to invest where investment is needed – education in social sciences, arts, media, culture, and so on

item.title: October in Delhi, November in Niagara: How Mark Carney’s premiership brings optimism to India-Canada ties
item.description: Mark Carney’s arrival as Canadian prime minister matters because he is not invested in yesterday’s fights
